SEARCH
Package org.example.server.rmi

Interface RMIServerInterface

All Superinterfaces:
Remote
All Known Implementing Classes:
RMIServerImpl
public interface RMIServerInterface extends Remote
The RMIServerInterface defines the methods that the RMI server will expose to clients. This interface extends the Remote interface, indicating that its methods can be called from another Java virtual machine.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    chooseColor(String username, String color)
    Allows a client to choose a color.
    String
    connect(String username, RMIClientCallbackInterface clientCallback)
    Connects a client to the RMI server.

  • Method Details

    • connect

      String connect(String username, RMIClientCallbackInterface clientCallback) throws RemoteException
      Connects a client to the RMI server. This method is called by the client to establish a connection with the server. It registers the client with the server and returns a message indicating the connection status.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the client attempting to connect.
      clientCallback - The callback interface for communicating with the client.
      Returns:
      A message indicating the connection status (e.g., "Connection successful" or "Username already taken").
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If an RMI-related error occurs.

    • chooseColor

      void chooseColor(String username, String color) throws RemoteException
      Allows a client to choose a color. This method is called by the client to select a color for their player. The server checks the availability of the chosen color and assigns it to the client if available.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the client choosing a color.
      color - The color chosen by the client.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If an RMI-related error occurs.
